titlestmt.titleproper: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Lewis family papers (series 36) 1694-1802
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Lewis family papers (series 36)

bioghist.p: The Lewis family is allied to the Smith family through the marriage of Mary Lewis (1808-1892) and George Smith (1804-1882). The founder of the Lewis family in America was Ralph Lewis. His son, grandson, and great-grandson were named Abraham I, II, and III, respectively. Abraham Lewis I (1675-1768) married Mary Morgan; and Abraham Lewis II (1714-1775) married Ann Reese in 1751. Abraham Lewis III (1759-1825) married Rebecca Lawrence in 1806; and their daughter Mary, married George Smith (1804-1882). Mary and George Smith were the grandparents of Lawrence M.C. Smith, husband of Eleanor Houston Smith.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
